text: Hilario "Larry" Ramos (April 19, 1942 - April 30, 2014) was an American singer and musician. He plays the guitar and banjo player. == Overview == === The New Christy Minstrels === Ramos began his career as a member of The New Christy Minstrels. In 1963, the group's first album won a Grammy Award. As a member of the band, Ramos is the first Asian-American to win a Grammy. Ramos left the band in 1966 because he was unhappy about the constant touring and him not being able to spend time with his family. === The Association === Ramos joined the pop band The Association in March 1967. During his time in the group, he sang the songs, "Never My Love" and "Windy". He was a member of the group until his death. Ramos was made a member of the Vocal Group Hall of Fame as a member of The Association in 2003. === Death === Ramos died of Melanoma in Washington, United States on April 30, 2014. He was age 72. == References == Category:1942 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Singers from Hawaii Category:American guitarists Category:American banjo players Category:The New Christy Minstrels members Category:Musicians from Hawaii Category:Deaths from melanoma
title: Larry Ramos
